intro: Cernohorskya, commonly known as the "scented snowbell," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that often emit a fragrant aroma. The plants typically grow in alpine or subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Cernohorskya species are known for their finely divided leaves and clustered inflorescences. Due to their limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, they are often considered rare or endangered in many parts of their range.
